definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: The smart-aleck rookie detective got himself in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 這個自作聰明的菜鳥偵探讓自己身陷危機。

sentences.english: The horror of the stupid is that they think themselves smart not for their stupidness.
sentences.chinese: 笨人的可怕不在其笨，而在其自作聰明。

sentences.english: Don’t try to offer brainy solutions.
sentences.chinese: 不要自作聰明地提供解決辦法。

sentences.english: They get carried away with their own cleverness and build things that are overcomplicated.
sentences.chinese: 他們自作聰明地把事情過度複雜化。

sentences.english: Off court he was witty but never smart-alecky.
sentences.chinese: 在場下，他十分風趣機智但從不自作聰明。

definition: lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation
pinyin: si3 ma3 dang4 huo2 ma3 yi1
